title: Shen & Yasuo Interaction
body: Just recently played a game as Shen into a team with a Yasuo. Found out my vorpal blade doesn't go over the windwall, which to me doesn't make any sense since it is not a projectile, it's more part of himself. Just want to bring the attention to the boards to see what others think, or if this was intentional.

replies.body: I'm pretty sure that would still be classified as a projectile since it's traveling from one champ to another location.
Wind wall also blocks ALL of namis ult, not only the part that would pass thru the wall.
It's a single massive wave that passes through each thing once, not like Ashe's volley, where each arrow is separate.

Anything that leaves the champion that flies to another is a projectile. There are two exceptions though:

1. snowballs, merely for the compatibility with poros on PoroKing.
2.  if the "projectile" is alive. That is why poros and any living object created by a champion is allowed through (think Ivern ult, Annie bear, Malz voidling).
It is a physical profjectile and it affects others as it phases through them.
